channel.title: programming on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in programming on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: Integrated Development Environments for PSoC
item.description: In order to program a Cypress Programmable System on a Chip (PSoCÂ®), you first need to install Integrated Development Environment (IDE) software on your computer.

item.title: Microchip AVR Microcontrollers
item.description: What microcontrollers does Atmel specialize in? Atmel was one of the top IC manufacturers that makes a number of 8-bit, 32-bit, and ARM microcontrollers, including the AVR microcontroller used in the Arduino.

item.title: Microchip PIC Microcontrollers
item.description: What microcontrollers does Microchip specialize in? Microchip specializes in 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit PIC microcontrollers.

item.title: Software design
item.description: What is a finite state machine? A finite state machine (FSM) is a way of modeling a system such that there are a limited number of finite “states” that a system can be in, and that it can only be in one of those states at a time.

item.title: Using Bitwise Operators in C
item.description: What are bitwise operators? Bitwise operators allow access to individual bits in a variable or register.
